sen.j: 那珂通世（なか みちよ、嘉永4年1月6日 (旧暦)（1851年2月6日） - 明治41年（1908年）3月2日）は、明治時代の歴史学者。
sen.e: Michiyo NAKA (February 6, 1851-March 2, 1908) was a historian in the Meiji period.
Michiyo NAKA (February 6, 1851-March 2, 1908) was a historian in the Meiji period.
Michiyo NAKA (February 6, 1851-March 2, 1908) was a historian in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 東洋史の概念を初めて生んだとされる人物。
sen.e: It is said that Naka was the first person who created the concept of Oriental history.
It is said that Naka was the first person who created the concept of Oriental history.
It is said that Naka was the first person who created the concept of Oriental history.

sen.j: 盛岡藩藩士・藤村盛徳の三男として生まれる。
sen.e: Michiyo was born the third son of Moritoku NAKA, a retainer of the Morioka Domain.
Michiyo was born as the third son of Moritoku NAKA, a feudal retainer of the Morioka clan.
sen.cmt: as, を補いました。retainer→feudal retainer,Domain→clan と修正しました。
sen.e: Michiyo was born as the third son of Moritoku NAKA, a feudal retainer of the Morioka clan.

sen.j: 幼名を荘次郎と言った。
sen.e: His childhood name was 'Sojiro.'
His childhood name was Sojiro.
sen.cmt: クォーツを削除しました。
sen.e: His childhood name was Sojiro.

sen.j: 藩校で優れた成績を修めたため、14歳の時に藩校の教授であった漢学者・那珂梧楼から乞われて江帾家の養子に入る。
sen.e: As he achieved excellent academic records at the domain school, Michiyo was requested by Goro EBATA, a scholar of Chinese classics and a lecture of the domain school, to join the Ebata family, and was adopted by Ebata at the age of 14.

As he achieved excellent academic records at the domain school, Michiyo was requested by Goro EBATA, a scholar of Chinese classics and a lecturer of the domain school, to join the Ebata family, and was adopted by Ebata at the age of 14.

As he achieved excellent academic records at the domain school, Michiyo was requested by Goro EBATA, a scholar of Chinese classics and a lecturer of the domain school, to join the Ebata family, and was adopted by Ebata at the age of 14.

sen.j: 後に養父が「那珂」と改姓したのに伴って、「那珂通世」を名乗った。
sen.e: Since his adopted father changed his surname to 'Naka' later, Michiyo called himself 'Michiyo NAKA.'
Since his adopted father changed his surname to 'Naka' later, Michiyo followed him to call himself 'Michiyo NAKA.'
sen.cmt: called→followed him to call と修正しました。
sen.e: Since his adopted father changed his surname to 'Naka' later, Michiyo followed him to call himself 'Michiyo NAKA.'

sen.j: 明治維新後、明治5年（1872年）に慶應義塾に入学して英学を学ぶ。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he enrolled Keio University in 1872 and studied English.
After the Meiji Restoration, he enrolled Keio University in 1872 and studied English.
After the Meiji Restoration, he enrolled Keio University in 1872 and studied English.

sen.j: 1876年、26歳の時に、「日本古代文字考」を『洋々社談』に発表する。
sen.e: In 1876, at the age of 26, he published the paper "Study of Ancient Japanese Characters" in the "Yoyo-sha Journal."
In 1876, at the age of 26, he released 'Study of Ancient Japanese Characters' in the "Yoyo-sha Journal."
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。published the paper→released と修正しました。「洋々社談」の定訳は確認が取れておりません。
sen.e: In 1876, at the age of 26, he released 'Study of Ancient Japanese Characters' in the "Yoyo-sha Journal."

sen.j: その後、師範学校・旧制中学校などの教師を務め、後に千葉師範学校・東京女子師範学校の校長も務めて女子教育に尽力した。
sen.e: Later, he worked as a teacher at schools for teacher training and junior high schools under the old system of education.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After that, he worked as a teacher at schools for teacher training and junior high schools under the old system of education, then later on, he contributed to the development of education for women, serving as the principal of Chiba Normal School and Tokyo Women's Normal School.
sen.cmt: Later→After that と修正しました。later on を補いました。（文の流れからして、ここは分割しないほうが意味が通りやすいとし、分割を一括に戻しました）
sen.e: After that, he worked as a teacher at schools for teacher training and junior high schools under the old system of education, then later on, he contributed to the development of education for women, serving as the principal of Chiba Normal School and Tokyo Women's Normal School.

sen.j: 後に第一高等学校 (旧制)や東京高等師範学校の教授となり、1896年に東京大学文科大学の講師も兼ねる。
sen.e: Afterwards, he became a teacher at Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school) and Tokyo Higher Normal School and worked also as an instructor at Literature school of Tokyo Imperial University from 1896.

Afterwards, he became a teacher at Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school) and Tokyo Higher Normal School, and worked also as an instructor at the Literature school of Tokyo Imperial University from 1896.
sen.cmt: カンマ、the を補いました。
sen.e: Afterwards, he became a teacher at Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school) and Tokyo Higher Normal School, and worked also as an instructor at the Literature school of Tokyo Imperial University from 1896.

sen.j: その間にも日本・朝鮮・中国の歴史における実証的な研究を多く発表した。
sen.e: In the meantime, he released many papers on the results of his practical studies about the history of Japan, Korea, and China.
In the meantime, he released many results of his practical studies about the history of Japan, Korea, and China.
sen.cmt: papers on the を削除しました。

sen.j: また、研究のために当時珍しかった自転車を使って国内外を旅行したために「自転車博士」という異名が付いたという。
sen.e: Also, it is said that he was nicknamed as 'bicycle doctor' because he travelled nationwide and overseas by bicycle, which was a novelty at that time, for his studies.
Also, it is said that he was nicknamed 'the bicycle doctor' because he traveled nationwide and overseas for his studies by bicycle, which was rare at that time.
sen.cmt: as を削除しました。the を補いました。travelled→traveled,a novelty→rare と修正しました。オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: Also, it is said that he was nicknamed 'the bicycle doctor' because he traveled nationwide and overseas for his studies by bicycle, which was rare at that time.

sen.j: 明治34年（1901年）、文学博士の学位を受ける。
sen.e: In 1901, he was conferred a doctor degree in Literature.
In 1901, he was conferred the degree of Doctor of Literature.
sen.cmt: a doctor degree in Literature→the degree of Doctor of Literature と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1901, he was conferred the degree of Doctor of Literature.

sen.j: 代表的な著作としては中国史の通史である『支那通史』（1888年-1890年、未完であるが、簡易かつ客観的であったことから中国でも読まれた、岩波文庫全3巻）や、「辛酉革命説」に基づいて日本の紀年問題を研究した「上世年紀考」（『史学雑誌』発表、三品影英増補『上世年紀考』所収）がある。
sen.e: His representative works include "Overview of Chinese History" (1880-1890, three volumes, published by Iwanami bunko: although it is an unfinished work, the book was read also in China thanks to its concise and objective style) and "Study of Ancient Calendar" (presented for "History Journal" and collected in " Study of Ancient Calendar, "revised book compiled by Kagehide MISHINA), a paper that studied about Japanese calendar systems base on Shinyu-kakumei-setsu (a prediction of revolution in Kanototori of the Chinese astrological calendar).

sen.j: また、『元朝秘史』を『成吉思汗実録』の題で邦訳して日本に紹介した。
sen.e: Also, he introduced to Japan "The Secret History of the Mongols," which he translated into Japanese and titled "Real Records of Genghis Khan."

sen.j: また、同じ盛岡藩出身の内藤虎次郎とは親しく、白鳥庫吉は中学教師時代の教え子である。
sen.e: Incidentally, he was on good terms with Konan NAITO, who also came from the Morioka Domain while Kurakichi SHIRATORI was one of his students when he worked as a teacher at junior high schools (Naito and Shiratori fought over estimated locations of ancient Japanese kingdom).

sen.j: 栃木県日光市の華厳滝で「巌頭之感」を書き残して投身自殺した藤村操は甥である。
sen.e: Misao FUJIMURA, who committed suicide at Kegon Falls, Nikko City, Tochigi Prefecture, with the farewell note titled "Gonto no Kan (Thoughts at the edge of Kegon Falls)," was Michiyo's nephew.
